alert.note: Alert for Charles City; New Kent; Prince George (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 3:01PM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Charles City, northeastern Prince George and New Kent Counties through 345 PM EST... At 301 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Burrowsville, or near Charles City, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Kent, Charles City, Claremont, Talleysville, Roxbury, Adkins Store, Ruthville, Burrowsville, Garysville, Providence Forge, Holdcroft, Tunstall, Taylors Corner, Chickahominy Shore, Mountcastle, Lanexa, Colonial Downs, Barnetts, New Hope and Wrights Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EST for south central, southeastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; New Kent; Prince George
